change.changenote: Regulation BEFORE self-repealed by s. 8, effective March 31, 2022.

bcl:definition.bcl:text: Act means the Local Government Act;

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: This section modifies section 69 [voting day registration only] of the Act.
A local government may, in relation to an eligible proceeding, by resolution, disapply a bylaw under section 69 of the Act.
This section modifies section 76 [Provincial list of votes as register of resident electors] of the Act.

A local government may, in relation to an eligible proceeding, by resolution, provide that the most current available Provincial list of voters prepared under the Election Act is to be the register of resident electors.
Sections 68 (2) and 76 (3) of the Act apply in relation to a resolution under subsection (2) of this section.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Advance voting opportunities — dates and voting places

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: This section modifies section 108 [additional advanced voting opportunities] of the Act.
A local government may, in relation to an eligible proceeding, by resolution,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: disapply a bylaw under section 108 (1) of the Act, or
do anything that may be done by bylaw under that section, other than repeal a bylaw under that section.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: This section modifies section 109 [special voting opportunities] of the Act.
A local government may, in relation to an eligible proceeding, by resolution,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: disapply a bylaw under section 109 (1) of the Act, or
do anything that may be done by bylaw under that section, other than repeal a bylaw under that section.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: This section modifies section 110 [mail ballot voting] of the Act.
A local government may, in relation to an eligible proceeding, by resolution,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: disapply a bylaw under section 110 (1) of the Act, or
do anything that may be done by bylaw under that section, other than repeal a bylaw under that section.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Section 110 (7) (e) of the Act applies in relation to a resolution under subsection (2) of this section.
A local government may, in relation to an eligible proceeding, by resolution,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: provide that section 110 (7) (b) and (c) of the Act is to be read as though a reference to a secrecy envelope were a reference to a secrecy sleeve, or
disapply section 110 (7) (b) of the Act and provide that section 110 (7) (c) is to be read as though a reference to a secrecy envelope were a reference to the ballots.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Requirements before elector may be given a ballot

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: This section modifies section 125 [requirements before elector may be given ballot] of the Act.
A local government may, in relation an eligible proceeding, by resolution, do any of the following:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: provide that section 125 (1) (b) of the Act is to be read as though it provided that the person must, as directed by an election official,

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: comply with section 125 (1) (b) as written, or
make an oral declaration of the facts set out in section 125 (1) (b), in which case the election official must make a record that the person made an oral declaration;

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: provide that section 125 (1) (c) of the Act is to be read as though it provided that the person must, as directed by an election official,

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: comply with section 125 (1) (c) as written, or
make an oral declaration of the facts set out in section 125 (1) (c), in which case the election official must make a record that the person made an oral declaration and of the facts declared;

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: provide that section 125 (2) (a) of the Act is to be read as though it provided that the person must, as directed by an election official,

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: comply with section 125 (2) (a) as written, or
make an oral declaration of the facts set out in section 125 (2) (a), in which case the election official must make a record that the person made an oral declaration and of the facts declared.

bcl:section.bcl:text: This regulation is repealed on March 31, 2022.

reg:content.reg:provisionsnote: [Provisions relevant to the enactment of this regulation: Local Government Act, R.S.B.C. 2015, c. 1, ss. 167.1 and 783.]
